title: Whitebeard Knew the True History
theoryText: Whitebeard's confident declaration that the One Piece is real and his statement about someone finding it and turning the world upside down suggests he knew the true history of the world, possibly learned from Gol D. Roger. His knowledge of what finding the One Piece would mean implies he understood the Void Century and the secrets of the World Government.
author: One Piece Fan Community

title: Whitebeard's Prophecy About Luffy
theoryText: When Whitebeard says 'You're not the one Roger was waiting for, Teach,' and mentions that someone will appear carrying Ace's will, many fans theorize he was specifically referring to Luffy. Whitebeard may have recognized that Luffy embodies the qualities Roger was looking for in his successor - the one who will find the One Piece and change the world.
author: One Piece Fan Community

title: The Great War Prophecy
theoryText: Whitebeard's prophecy about a massive war that will engulf the world when the One Piece is found has led fans to theorize about the Final War arc. This war would involve all the major powers - the World Government, Marines, Revolutionaries, Yonko, and pirates - fighting for the future of the world. Whitebeard's words terrified Sengoku because he knows this prophecy is based on truth.
author: One Piece Fan Community

title: Blackbeard Can't Be Pirate King
theoryText: Whitebeard's rejection of Blackbeard as 'the one Roger was waiting for' is theorized to mean that despite Blackbeard's power and ambition, he fundamentally lacks the qualities needed to become Pirate King. His methods are dishonorable, he doesn't embody freedom, and he doesn't carry the Will of D. in the way Roger intended.
author: One Piece Fan Community
